list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: His work will be remembered for eternity.

list_definition.definition: the state or time after death.

list_ex_of_english: And there is no end to this misery : the condemned are doomed to experience these terrible torments for all of eternity.
Underlying this motif, therefore, is a dialectical relationship between history and eternity whose interrelationship ultimately redeems time itself.
One cannot constrain eternity to either the past or the future.
From this text, one could gain the impression that it is possible for dialectic to prove the eternity or the non-eternity of the world.
This leads, then, to a discussion of divine eternity.
A whole lot of drunk folks, you know, don't care for nothing, and they just bring eternity, the blues do.
At every moment for the rest of eternity there will be sin that has not been expiated, wrongs that have not been vindicated.
On the other hand, temporal eternity, or even eternal regularity a parte ante, is no explanation of the fact that something exists here and now.
